intro: Tetranthera pentandra, commonly known as the red-rooted mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant that grows on the branches of host trees. It has small, opposite, ovate leaves that are typically dark green with a slightly pubescent underside. The plant produces tiny, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its berries are red or orange when mature and contain a single seed. Tetranthera pentandra is native to tropical regions of South America and is often found in humid, shaded forest environments.
